html:
If you’re in the market for a franchise system that sells sandwiches, there are plenty of options to choose from. With such a variety of choices, there’s something for everyone.

In this article, we’ll discuss the best sandwich franchises to open up shop. So which one is right for you? Read on to find out!

What Are Sub Sandwich Franchises?

These franchises rank among the most popular fast food chains globally within the restaurant industry. They provide a diverse selection of sandwiches, such as submarine sandwiches, grilled sandwiches, wraps, and salads.

Most franchises have a similar business model, offering customers a choice of meat, cheese, and toppings assembled on a fresh bun or roll.

  • READ MORE: See our Franchise Guide

Why You Should Consider a Sandwich Franchise?

The sandwich chain is an excellent opportunity to enter the food business. Here are five reasons why you should think about starting your own sandwich shop franchise:

  • Proven concept. Sandwich shops are a proven business model with a long history of success, and there are plenty of well-known and popular chains to choose from.
  • Typically very profitable. Franchise sandwich shops are typically very profitable, with some chains generating millions of dollars in annual revenue.
  • Be your own boss. As a franchise owner, you’ll be in charge of your own business and will have the independence to make decisions that are best for you and your customers.
  • Brand recognition and marketing support. When you open a franchise, you’ll benefit from the brand recognition and marketing support of the parent company.
  • Relatively easy to operate. Making submarine sandwiches is not rocket science, and most franchisors offer comprehensive training programs.

General Criteria for Choosing the Best Sandwich Franchises: Our Methodology

We will evaluate these criteria on a scale of importance from 1 to 5, with 5 being the most critical:

  1. Quality and Variety of Ingredients (5/5):
    • The quality of ingredients used in sandwiches is paramount. Fresh, high-quality ingredients lead to delicious and healthier options. A wide variety of ingredients allows for diverse menu offerings.
  2. Franchise Reputation (4/5):
    • A strong and positive reputation in the franchise industry is important. Franchises with a history of success and customer satisfaction are more likely to provide support and a proven business model.
  3. Location and Accessibility (5/5):
    • Location is crucial for foot traffic and customer accessibility. Proximity to business districts, schools, or other high-traffic areas can significantly impact success.
  4. Menu Innovation (4/5):
    • A dynamic and evolving menu keeps customers engaged and encourages repeat visits. Sandwich franchises that offer new and unique sandwich creations maintain a competitive edge.
  5. Training and Support (5/5):
    • Comprehensive training programs and ongoing support from the franchisor are vital for success. This includes staff training, marketing support, and operational assistance.
  6. Costs and Fees (4/5):
    • Evaluate the initial franchise fee, startup costs, and ongoing royalty fees. Ensure they align with your budget and financial resources.
  7. Customer Base and Demand (5/5):
    • Assess the demand for sandwiches in your target market. A franchise located in an area with a high demand for quick and tasty sandwich options is more likely to thrive.
  8. Marketing and Advertising Support (4/5):
    • Franchises that provide marketing materials, strategies, and advertising support help you attract and retain customers more effectively.
  9. Flexibility and Customization (3/5):
    • Some franchises offer more flexibility in menu customization than others. Depending on your preferences, this criterion may vary in importance.
  10. Health and Dietary Options (3/5):
    • Consider the availability of healthy and dietary-specific options. Meeting the needs of various customer preferences can expand your customer base.

Best Sandwich Franchises

Do you want to offer cold sandwiches, hot sandwiches, or specialty sandwiches? Will you offer sides like potato salad?

Whatever you want to offer, you’re sure to find the right opportunity in our list below:

Firehouse Subs

If you’re in search of a delicious and budget-friendly franchise, Firehouse Subs, which started franchising in 1995, is an excellent choice. They provide tasty carryout-style sandwiches with a distinctive twist: all of their meats and cheeses are steamed before being served on freshly baked bread.

With an initial single-unit Firehouse Subs franchise fee of only $20,000 and an average total cost of $412,731, it’s a relatively affordable option. Plus, you’ll need liquid cash of at least $100,000 to qualify. Other fees include a 6% royalty fee on sales and an advertising fee of 3-5% of sales.

Pita Pit

Opening this franchise can be a very lucrative decision. It’s home to Lebanese-style pita sandwiches and began franchising in 1995.

The initial franchise fee is $24,000-$30,000, depending on your location and restaurant size. The total estimated initial investment is $353,154 – $574,486. Net worth requirements are $100,000 and liquid assets of at least $75,000.

Jimmy John’s

Third on our list of franchise opportunities is Jimmy John’s, which was started by Jimmy John Liautaud in 1983. He was 19 at the time and borrowed $20,000 from his dad to start the company.

You can start a franchise that has no royalty fees (for a limited time) and an advertising fee of just 4.5%. Your investment will range from $316,100 to $558,600, and you’ll need a net worth of at least $1 million.

Blimpie

With an initial investment ranging from $232,770 to $524,325, you can become a Blimpie franchisee. The company has a long-standing history and operates more than 200 franchise units. A minimum liquid capital of $125,000 is required.

Charleys Philly Cheesesteak

If you’re looking to open a Charley’s Grilled Subs franchise, be aware that the initial investment will range from $251,637 to $1,002,700. The company requires a $24,500 initial franchise fee for the first unit and $15,000 for each additional unit. There is also a 6% royalty fee on gross sales.

Penn Station East Coast Subs

If you’d like to open a Penn Station East Coast Subs franchise, you’ll need to have a net worth of at least $500,000 and liquid assets of at least $300,000.

The initial franchise fee is $25,000 per restaurant, and royalties are 2%-8% of sales (depending on sales volume). There is also a national advertising fee of 2% and local marketing co-op fees that vary by market.

Togo’s Sandwiches

Opening a Togo’s Sandwiches franchise will require an initial investment of between $231,500 and $476,500. This includes the franchise fee of $30,000. You will also be responsible for a 3% marketing fund contribution and a 5% royalty fee based on gross sales.

Miami Grill (formerly Miami Subs Grill)

Opening a Miami Grill franchise is a great way to get into the restaurant business. The initial franchise fee is $45,000, and the initial investment is between $310,000 and $685,000.

You’ll need a strong credit history, a net worth of at least $700,000, and $250,000 in liquid assets to qualify.

Which Wich

Which is a sandwich chain that originated in Dallas, Texas. Guests write their orders on sandwich bags that have menus printed on them.

To begin a franchise with Which Wich, you need to possess $150,000 in liquid assets and a total net worth of $250,000. The overall cost per unit can differ based on the size and characteristics of various markets and locations.

Royalty fees amount to 6% of gross sales, in addition to a national “Brand Development Fund” fee that is set at 3% of gross sales.

McAlister’s Deli

Want to open a McAlister’s Deli franchise? Get ready for a tasty investment. McAlister’s average net sales were $1,865,861.

You’ll need a minimum liquid capital of $425,000 and a minimum net worth of $1,000,000. The estimated initial investment for a franchised McAlister’s Deli ranges from $821,000 to $1,308,850.

Other Major National Restaurant Franchise Options for Sandwiches

Let’s continue with our list by looking at one of the top sandwich franchises around:

Subway

Opening a Subway isn’t overly complicated, but it does require some initial investment. The good news is that the total investment needed to open a subway franchise isn’t too high, starting at just $116,000.

The franchise fee isn’t bad either at $15,000. As for other fees, you’ll be paying 8% of your weekly sales in royalties to Subway, as well as 4.5% of your sales in advertising fees.

Goodcents Deli Fresh Subs

Joseph Bisogno founded Goodcents during a period characterized by significant economic changes. He is a serial entrepreneur who had a lemonade stand at a young age and owned an ice cream truck as a teenager. To open your own shop, you’ll need a 680 or higher credit score, a $200,000 net worth, and at least $100,000 in liquid capital. The total investment ranges from $333,550 to $499,700.

Jersey Mike’s Subs

Jersey Mike’s Subs is a great option for anyone looking to open a well-known franchise. The initial franchise fee is $18,500, and the total investment ranges from $144,668 to $786,233. The company has a great reputation and strong brand recognition.

Steak Escape

Steak Escape has a franchise fee of only $25,000, with an initial investment of $223,000 to $660,000.

You’ll need a minimum of $200,000 in liquid assets and an overall net worth of $400,000. Their royalty fee is 6% of gross sales, and marketing fees range from 0.5% to 3%.

Potbelly Sandwich Shop

Potbelly is located in about 90 cities across the country. To open a Potbelly franchise, you’ll need a passion for great food, people skills, and about $565,000+, including a $40,000 franchise fee.

Capriotti’s

Capriotti’s is an award-winning shop that’s won a Top 50 Franchises award. Opening a Capriotti’s will run you about $40,000 in franchise fees alone.

However, you should be prepared to invest a total of $417,100 to $748,500 in the entire process.

PrimoHoagies

To qualify for a PrimoHoagies franchise, you must have a minimum net worth of $425,000. The initial investment required falls between $215,500 and $554,500.

The franchise fee is $15,000 – $40,000. PrimoHoagies has a 6% royalty fee and a 2% advertising fee.

Erbert & Gerbert’s Sandwich Shops

Opening an Erbert & Gerbert’s Sandwich Shops franchise starts at a total investment of $194,820 – $393,270.

To qualify, you’ll need $80,000 in liquid assets and a net worth of at least $300,000.

Cousins Subs

Cousins Subs provides franchises requiring an investment between $292,200 and $797,500, which encompasses a franchise fee of $25,000. Additionally, there is a 6% royalty fee that must be paid.

Schlotzsky’s

Schlotzsky’s is a sandwich chain with over 300 locations and average net sales of $1.1 million. The estimated initial investment for Schlotzsky’s ranges from $522,570 to $1,635,380.

The minimum net worth required is $1 million, with a minimum of $300,000 in liquid capital.

Sandwich Franchise Ownership Frequently Asked Questions

What is the typical franchise fee for a sandwich shop?

Franchise fees for sandwich shops can vary widely. They typically range from $15,000 to $45,000, depending on the specific franchisor and the type of sandwich shop.

What are royalty fees, and how do they work in a sandwich shop franchise?

Royalty fees are ongoing payments made by franchisees to the franchisor. They are typically calculated as a percentage of the franchise’s gross sales. In the sandwich shop industry, royalty fees typically range from 2% to 8% of sales.

Are there advertising fees in addition to royalty fees?

Yes, many sandwich shop franchises require franchisees to contribute to advertising or marketing funds. These fees can vary but often range from 2% to 5% of gross sales. These funds are used to promote the brand and support national and local marketing efforts.

What are the financial requirements for potential franchisees?

Financial requirements can vary significantly among sandwich shop franchises. Typically, franchisees need to demonstrate a minimum net worth and liquid capital. Net worth requirements can range from $100,000 to over $1 million, and liquid capital requirements usually start at around $75,000.

Is prior experience in the restaurant industry necessary to open a sandwich shop franchise?

While prior experience in the restaurant industry can be beneficial, it is not always a strict requirement. Many franchisors offer comprehensive training programs to prepare franchisees for success, regardless of their previous experience.

How long does it take to open a sandwich shop franchise from initial inquiry to opening day?

The timeline for opening a sandwich shop franchise can vary. It typically involves several steps, including application, approval, site selection, training, and construction. On average, it may take anywhere from several months to over a year, depending on various factors.

What ongoing support can franchisees expect from the franchisor?

Franchisees can expect ongoing support from the franchisor, including assistance with marketing, operations, and training. Most sandwich shop franchises provide comprehensive support to help franchisees maintain the brand’s standards and grow their businesses.

Can franchisees own multiple sandwich shop locations?

Many sandwich shop franchisors offer opportunities for franchisees to own multiple locations. However, this often depends on the franchisee’s financial qualifications, experience, and the availability of suitable locations.

What happens if a franchisee wants to sell their sandwich shop?

If a franchisee wishes to sell their sandwich shop, they typically need to follow the franchisor’s guidelines for selling a franchise. This process may involve finding a qualified buyer, obtaining approval from the franchisor, and completing the necessary legal and financial steps.

What support does the franchisor provide for site selection and restaurant design?

Franchisors often offer assistance in selecting suitable locations for sandwich shops and provide guidelines for restaurant design and layout. They may also offer support in negotiating leases and securing real estate.

Are there opportunities for customization in menu offerings within a sandwich shop franchise?

The level of menu customization can vary among sandwich shop franchises. Some offer more flexibility for franchisees to introduce local or seasonal items, while others maintain a standardized menu across all locations. Franchisees should inquire about menu flexibility when considering a franchise opportunity.

What Is the Largest Sandwich Franchise?

Subway is the largest among sandwich franchises, boasting approximately $11 billion in annual sales, 43,600 locations across 100 countries, and a workforce of 410,000 employees. On average, each franchise unit generates around $422,000 in annual revenue.

How Much Does it Cost to Open a Sub-Sandwich Franchise?

The cost of opening a sub-franchise depends on the franchisor and the location. Some franchisors require as much as $2.1 million, including a franchise fee. Each franchise has its own costs to start and run, royalty fees, ad fees, etc. So, do your research before making a decision.

Is Owning a Sandwich Shop Profitable?

Yes, owning one can be profitable. However, this will depend on several factors, such as the franchisor, the location, and your own business acumen. Your marketing and management skills will also play a role in your success.
